tier of a character (tiers are 1-10, 11-20, etc...)"},"getDuelCost(uint256)":{"details":"gets the amount of SKILL that is risked per duel"},"getDuelQueue()":{"details":"returns the current duel queue"},"getEntryWager(uint256)":{"details":"gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena"},"getEntryWagerByTier(uint8)":{"details":"gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena by tier"},"getMatchablePlayerCount(uint256)":{"details":"returns the amount of matcheable characters"},"getOpponent(uint256)":{"details":"get an attacker's opponent"},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"isCharacterUnderAttack(uint256)":{"details":"checks wether or not the character is actively someone else's opponent"},"performDuels(uint256[])":{"details":"performs a list of duels"},"prepareDuel(uint256)":{"details":"adds a character to the duel queue"},"reRollOpponent(uint256)":{"details":"attempts to find a new opponent for a fee"},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"withdrawFromArena(uint256)":{"details":"withdraws a character and its items from the arena. if the character is in a battle, a penalty is documentation.text: @dev enter the arena with a character, a weapon and optionally a shield

@dev withdraws a character and its items from the arena.
 if the character is in a battle, a penalty is charged
@dev attempts to find an opponent for a character
@dev attempts to find a new opponent for a fee
@dev adds a character to the duel queue

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer,uint256) view returns (bool)

documentation.text: @dev wether or not the character is still in time to start a duel
@dev checks wether or not the character is actively someone else's opponent

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer,uint256) view returns (bool)

documentation.text: @dev checks wether or not the character is currently in the duel queue
@dev gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena
@dev gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena by tier
@dev gets the amount of SKILL that is risked per duel
@dev gets the amount of SKILL that is risked per duel by tier
@dev gets the arena tier of a character (tiers are 1-10, 11-20, etc...)

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

documentation.text: @dev assigns an opponent to a character

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer,uint256) view returns (bool)

documentation.text: @dev removes a character from arena and clears it's matches

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

documentation.text: @dev returns the amount of matcheable characters

attributes.type: function (struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

enterArena(uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,.details: enter the arena with a character, a weapon and optionally a shield

findOpponent(uint256).details: attempts to find an opponent for a character

getArenaTier(uint256).details: gets the arena tier of a character (tiers are 1-10, 11-20, etc...)

getDuelCost(uint256).details: gets the amount of SKILL that is risked per duel

getEntryWager(uint256).details: gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena

getEntryWagerByTier(uint8).details: gets the amount of SKILL required to enter the arena by tier

getMatchablePlayerCount(uint256).details: returns the amount of matcheable characters

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isCharacterUnderAttack(uint256).details: checks wether or not the character is actively someone else's opponent

prepareDuel(uint256).details: adds a character to the duel queue

reRollOpponent(uint256).details: attempts to find a new opponent for a fee

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

withdrawFromArena(uint256).details: withdraws a character and its items from the arena. if the character is in a battle, a penalty is charged
